thread.title: Mets notes: Harvey to pitch in Game 1 against Cubs - Mets
thread.title_full: Mets notes: Harvey to pitch in Game 1 against Cubs - Mets - NorthJersey.com

author: MATT EHALT
title: Mets notes: Harvey to pitch in Game 1 against Cubs - Mets
text:
Matt Harvey will start Game 1 of the NLCS on Saturday night against the Cubs.
Harvey started just once in the NLDS because of his innings restrictions coming off Tommy John surgery, but is now in line to start twice in the best-of-seven series.
"We’re obviously excited right now and regroup [today]," said Harvey, who won his first career postseason start Wednesday. "I can’t wait. We’re all excited to go back home, and excited to be where we are. We have a lot of confidence going into this series."
HESITATION: Noah Syndergaard made his first career relief appearance and fired a scoreless seventh inning to help preserve the 3-2 victory over the Dodgers.
Syndergaard warmed up four times in the pen before coming in, and struck out two while also issuing a walk. It’s uncertain which game he will start in the NLCS.
"Exciting. It was a lot of fun," Syndergaard said. "Travis [d’Arnaud] met me on the mound and talked about executing one pitch at a time, and kept it as simple as that."
LINEUP DISCUSSION: Collins said the team considered sitting Lucas Duda on Thursday, although it wasn’t given too much thought. Duda went 0-for-3 but had a pivotal walk that helped set up the game-tying run in the fourth inning, and finished 2-for-18 (.111) in the series.
"Lucas has been the guy," Collins said before the game. "You never know when he breaks out, because as we’ve seen, if he breaks out he carries you."
BRIEFS: Collins said he had been told infielder Juan Uribe (chest) had yet to begin any baseball activities. That indicated Uribe will not be available for the NLCS. … Jacob deGrom went 2-0 with a 1.38 ERA over 13 innings in the series, outdueling Clayton Kershaw and Zack Greinke in his two starts. … Jeurys Familia became the first Met to record a six-out save since Jesse Orosco in Game 7 of the 1986 World Series. … The Dodgers’ fell to 4-1 in elimination playoff games since moving to Los Angeles in 1958. … Justin Turner’s two doubles gave him a Dodgers playoff-record six in one series.
